page.title: 09HEALTH SERVICES _ PART ONE
page.content:
BELMONT HEALTH CENTRE, KENTON LANE
This Health Centre was opened in September 1979 to replace another which closed in Wealdstone. It was built on the site of an old railway station. A community centre is planned next door, partly on the car park. The building is designed to make access easy for the disabled and people with prams and pushchairs. It houses 2 group practices with 8 General Practitioners in all. Open hours are 0830-1830. Appointments are necessary. The centre also contains baby clinics, hearing-test facilities, a chiropody and a dental practice. A "dial-a-ride" scheme operates to carry patients to the centre. A small charge is made for this service.
